channel.title: Please Help
channel.description:
Hello,
I'm at a big problem when getting started to create my first ever server.. I'v followed hundreds of guides and didn't reach any successes, i'v been playing RSPS for about 2 years. I dont have great knowledge on Java or Developing/Coding.. I have a 64 bit, win 7 computer with a SKY Router.. I have many problems when trying to make my very own server.. I dont like asking for help but it came down to this. I would just like to mention 2 of the problems.
1st Problem: When i try and run a .bat file on a source or client it always fails E.g Run, Compilers. i try editing them aswell to direct to my java but still it doesn't work. I have 7 different types of Java versions JRE6, JRE7, JDK 1.6.0.13.. etc.. Only thing works is .Jar files for me. Heres a screenie of when i try running a .bat file of a rsps source: [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/wa5xc3.png[/img]
And when i try to edit it: [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/28ib2ao.png[/img]
2nd Problem: I cant port forward, i heard it is the biggest problem that people get when creating a server. I try anf get to my router page and it asks for a user name and pass.. I'v got no idea what they are, i asked my dad and he didn't know either. I tryed putting "Admin" as a user like seen on other guides but it never lets me on the page.
I figured out that i can host with utorrent, and i was also wondring is this possible and does it work?
[u][b]Please read everything before posting.[/b][/u]
Please help me

item.title: Please Help
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

1st problem (compiler): It may say that because you do not have environmental variables set or you java is set into the wrong folder I believe with 64 bit windows 7 there is also a Program Files (x86) folder that may have some java it in. In additon, you could try using \java.exe" instead of javac.

2nd problem: Utorrent is possible for some routers but its bad for hosting why I say this is because it blocks the ports from you connecting onto the server. Also, Visit this tutorial for a setup on how to portforward your sky router http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,538695.msg3941766.html#msg3941766

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help
item.dc:creator: @kingcobra805 kingcobra805
item.description:
@kingcobra805 wrote:

For the 2nd image change your Java Directory to…

“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe”

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help
item.dc:creator: @asmo11 asmo11
item.description:
@asmo11 wrote:

Hello,

I’m at a big problem when getting started to create my first ever server… I’v followed hundreds of guides and didn’t reach any successes, i’v been playing RSPS for about 2 years. I dont have great knowledge on Java or Developing/Coding… I have a 64 bit, win 7 computer with a SKY Router… I have many problems when trying to make my very own server… I dont like asking for help but it came down to this. I would just like to mention 2 of the problems.

1st Problem:
When i try and run a .bat file on a source or client it always fails E.g Run, Compilers. i try editing them aswell to direct to my java but still it doesn’t work. I have 7 different types of Java versions JRE6, JRE7, JDK 1.6.0.13… etc… Only thing works is .Jar files for me.
Heres a screenie of when i try running a .bat file of a rsps source:

And when i try to edit it:

2nd Problem:
I cant port forward, i heard it is the biggest problem that people get when creating a server. I try anf get to my router page and it asks for a user name and pass… I’v got no idea what they are, i asked my dad and he didn’t know either. I tryed putting “Admin” as a user like seen on other guides but it never lets me on the page.

I figured out that i can host with utorrent, and i was also wondring is this possible and does it work?

Please read everything before posting.

Please help me

Read full topic
